page.title: 08A REFUGEE FROM VIETNAM
page.content: I was not born here, I was born in Vietnam. I got here in a boat. I remember when I was very young in Vietnam that my Gran looked after me. My Dad worked in a place where he made noodles, and I used to go there and eat some of the noodle and then fall asleep on top of the pile of noodles then when I woke up I had flour all over my face. I had to go to school and I learnt to dance and sing and manners. I only had two friends in Vietnam. Then one day I had to go away in a boat. My Gran did not want me to go with my parents; she wanted to keep me with her. It was so cramped on the boat because there were a lot of people. It was horrible in the boat. We had the best part of the boat. We were in the middle of the boat, some people had to stay on the top of the boat and they might fall off.
